bill_title: appropriate one-time funds for enhancement of secondary career and technical education.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to appropriate money for enhancement of secondary career and technical education. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The secretary of revenue shall deposit the first one million five hundred thousand dollars ($1,500,000) of revenue collected pursuant to chapter 10-46A in the secondary career and technical education enhancement fund which is hereby created in the state treasury. The secondary career and technical education enhancement fund shall be used to provide grants to school districts for secondary career and technical education program grants. Section 2. There is hereby appropriated from the secondary career and technical enhancement fund the sum of one million five hundred thousand dollars ($1,500,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Education for allocation to school districts to provide funding for secondary career and technical education programs. Section 3. The secretary of the Department of Education shall distribute the funds appropriated by this Act to school districts through a competitive grant process. The secretary shall promulgate rules, pursuant to chapter 1-26, to define the criteria used in awarding grants, and to establish grant application procedures and timelines. When awarding grants, the secretary shall give priority consideration to those programs that are innovative or enhanced, that are collaborative efforts, or that include entrepreneurial activities, internships, or career guidance. Section 4. The secretary of education shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 5. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2014, shall revert in accordance with the procedures prescribed in chapter 4-8.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to appropriate one-time funds for enhancement of secondary career and technical education. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of one million five hundred thousand dollars ($1,500,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Education for allocation to school districts to provide funding for secondary career and technical education programs. Section 2. The secretary of the Department of Education shall distribute the funds appropriated by this Act to school districts through a competitive grant process. The secretary shall promulgate rules, pursuant to chapter 1-26, to define the criteria used in awarding grants, and to establish grant application procedures and timelines. When awarding grants, the secretary shall give priority consideration to those programs that are innovative or enhanced, that are collaborative efforts, or that include entrepreneurial activities, internships, or career guidance. Section 3. The secretary of education shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 4. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2014, shall revert in accordance with the procedures prescribed in chapter 4-8.
